before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"dpng7","text":"Most updates to existing NCBI submissions are performed through email requests to each respective NCBI database (e.g. BioSample, BioProject, Sequence Read Archive, and Pathogen Detection). NCBI curators within each respective database expect these emails to update and retract data. It is their job to help the data stay current, so do not hesitate to correct errors when they are spotted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"41p3a","text":"PURPOSE: After data are submitted to NCBI submitters often encounter the need to update, retract, or replace these records. This is called data curation. This protocol provides instructions for keeping these records up-to-date for each relevant database at NCBI. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8um9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r0um","text":"SCOPE: This protocol covers curation for the following NCBI databases:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq371","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk08v","text":"BioProject","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qrbt","text":"BioSample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emppa","text":"Sequence Read Archive","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5j6j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2svco","text":"V2. Edit submissions using the NCBI portal (Manage data). Moved \"how to find my data\" content to a new protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: Timme, R.E., Wolfgang, W.J., Balkey, M. et al. Optimizing open data to support one health: best practices to ensure interoperability of genomic data from bacterial pathogens. One Health Outlook 2, 20 (2020). https://doi.org/10.1186/s42522-020-00026-3. Timme R.E., Sanchez Leon M., Allard M.W. (2019) Utilizing the Public GenomeTrakr Database for Foodborne Pathogen Traceback. In: Bridier A. (eds) Foodborne Bacterial Pathogens. Methods in Molecular Biology, vol 1918. Humana, New York, NY. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-1-4939-9000-9_17

parent_collections.title: Utilizing the Public GenomeTrakr Database for Foodborne Pathogen Traceback

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"brhbn","text":"Email for BioProject: bioprojecthelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vip0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e8fr","text":"Use this email for the following tasks, include the BioProject accession in the email subject:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86fds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n43k","text":"Questions about errors or processing of a BioProject submission","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amave","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4aemt","text":"Convert a Data BioProject to an Umbrella BioProject ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vtm2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1666v","text":"Re-assign a BioProject from one Umbrella BioProject to another","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ntco","text":"SRA retraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bn7t9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fs38n","text":"An SRA record should only be retracted for the following reasons:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2mifs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cn0t1","text":"Discovery of poor quality data.  Lab intends to re-generate data (starting at appropriate wet-lab step, re-isolation, DNA extraction, library prep, or sequencing) and re-submit the data.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"51a1e","text":"Sample mix-ups that cannot be resolved by re-parenting or correcting the BioSamples. Lab intends to re-generate (starting at appropriate wet-lab step, re-isolation, DNA extraction, library prep, or sequencing) and re-submit the data.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5q1sv","text":"Discovery of multiple runs per isolate. Laboratory would like to have only one run per isolate in the system.  No re-sequencing planned.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"i5h7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5c7gi","text":"DO NOT retract an SRA submission, then attempt to re-submit the same files. This will get flagged as a duplicate within NCBI's validation check and and will be rejected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":169}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9rog4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e266n","text":"Emails should include a list of SRR accessions to retract and reason for retraction (i.e. sample mix-up, quality of data, etc.). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":62,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3vtnk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bgold","text":"*Although the data submissions appear visibly linked at NCBI (you can navigate between databases with links on each record) the data may not be linked in a way that works with retractions. Therefore, if you need to retract a bad SRA run, you should also request that all other data (such as GenBank assemblies or Pathogen Detection analyses) also be retracted, even if you didn’t submit them yourself.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4t2m3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4d0fh","text":"Email template:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e33hu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e9op2","text":"
